utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s from Game of Thrones. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know. If we’re going to start a fantasy sword collection, and I’ve long thought we should, is this really the sword to start with?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What did you have in mind?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, off the top of my head, I’d have to go with Excalibur. It gives you the right to rule England.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It would be a replica of a movie prop.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fair enough. It’d give you the right to rule a replica of England.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, they don’t have an Excalibur here, so what do you want to do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mm. Tough decision. There’s no weaponry from Lord of the Rings, forged in a Chinese sweatshop?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Just Bilbo Baggins’ sword over there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Two grown men with a hobbit’s dagger; wouldn’t we look silly? Okay, let’s go for it.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, I see you guys have found my little treasure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s okay, I guess.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay? It’s magnificent.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Buh-buh-buh-buh! What do you want for it?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, it’s hard to put a price on something that’s a copy of something that was on pay cable. But for my friends, let’s say 250?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s pretty steep.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, it’s a limited edition. They only made 8,000 of these bad boys.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Only 8,000? We’re wasting precious time. Buy it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang on. Can you do any better?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Are you kidding? I’m already giving you the friends and family discount.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, did you hear that? We’re getting the friends and family discount. We are honoured and we will take it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Slow down. Two hundred.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you doing? Two fifty is already the discounted price.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Will you shut up?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Tell you what, I’ll go two thirty-five.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nope. Maybe another time.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay, two twenty five, my final offer.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Take it, take it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Two hundred.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Man, you’re killing me!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Killing you? I can’t breathe.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Two ten, and I’m losing money.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, now, we can’t let him lose money, Leonard. I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Two ten and you throw in the Iron Man helmet.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Are you crazy? That helmet’s signed by Robert Downey Jr.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay, if you’re going to question the importance of an actor’s signature on a plastic helmet from a movie based on a comic book, then all of our lives have no meaning!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Just the sword, two ten.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Thank you. I can eat meat this week.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: See that? I just saved us forty bucks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve long said, what you lack in academic knowledge you make up for in street smarts.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: You want me to wrap it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it’s okay. I’m gonna stab my friend in the chest.

utterance.speaker: Wil Wheaton (entering)
utterance.content: Hey, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Ah, hey, Wil.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, Wil Wheaton.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hi, Sheldon. Nice sword.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s part of my sword collection. Do you have a sword collection?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not surprised.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Here’s the Batman 612 with the Jim Lee alternate cover that you wanted.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Awesome. What do I owe you?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Forty bucks.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Good deal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sucker. Didn’t even ask for the friends and family discount.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hey, I’m having a party at my house on Friday, and I was hoping you would stop by.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Will there be girls there?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Yeah, of course.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: ‘Cause there wasn’t last time.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: There will be girls. You guys are invited if you want to come by.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: All right, great. Later.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I see what you’re doing. You accept an invitation to a party at the home of my sworn enemy, he tells everyone we’re going to be there, and when we don’t show, he looks the fool. Fiendishly clever.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was actually thinking about going.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And then declaring the party a fiasco and storming out, leaving him humiliated in front of his guests. Love it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I was gonna grab Raj and Howard and have a good time.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, great, more guys. It’s gonna be another Wil Wheaton sausage-fest.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, can you grab me a water?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Possibly.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can you or can’t you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not that simple, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It never is, is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: At this moment, our relationship exists in two mutually contradictory states. Until you either do not go or go to Wil Wheaton’s party, you are simultaneously my friend and not my friend. I’m characterizing this phenomenon as Schrodinger’s Friendship.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Got it. Can I have my water?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course. Now get it yourself, you traitor.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, what is going on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In case you have forgotten, Schrodinger’s cat is a thought experiment…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, I didn’t forget. Um, there’s this cat in a box and until you open it, it’s either dead or alive or both. Although, back in Nebraska, our cat got stuck in my brother’s camp trunk, and we did not need to open it to know there was all kinds of dead cat in there.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Homespun stories, knowledge of physics and a bosom that defies it. You’re the whole package, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: Howard (arriving)
utterance.content: Sorry I’m late. Uh, I got great news. NASA picked my team’s design for the deep field space telescope that’s going on the International Space Station this spring.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, that’s wonderful! Congratulations!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It gets better. Someone has to go up with the telescope as a payload specialist, and guess who that someone is.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mohammed Lee.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Who’s Mohammed Lee?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mohammed is the most common first name in the world, Lee, the most common surname. As I didn’t know the answer, I thought that gave me a mathematical edge.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s me, Sheldon. It’s me. I’m going up in space! Technically, I’m an astronaut.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Wow, that’s amazing!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hang on a second. NASA doesn’t have a shuttle any more. How are you going to get up there?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, well, it’s really cool. You fly to Moscow, they take you out to Kazakhstan, and then you get into a Russian Soyuz rocket which shoots you into a low earth orbit. Or just sits there on the launch pad because the Kazakhi mafia sold the rocket fuel on the black market.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are those Russian rockets safe?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I mean, safe as it can be when it was built by the good folks who brought you Chernobyl.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’d like to propose a toast. The dream to go up into space is one we all share, and Howard’s making that a reality. We’re all very proud of you.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That was a lovely toast. Kudos.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Simultaneously, a festival of cloying clichés. You sicken me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re really quiet. Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Fine. Just a little tired.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I hope not too tired, because I’m feeling particularly masculine right now. All systems go, if you catch my drift.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I always catch your drift.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, well, something’s obviously bugging you. What is it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I just can’t believe you signed up for the space program without even talking to me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I get it. You’re worried about me. That is so sweet. You know, there’s a saying we have at NASA. What makes the right stuff so right is that it always comes home.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Just stop talking, Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: This isn’t the reaction I expected when I told you I was gonna be an astronaut.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What did you think was going to happen?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Honestly? Sex.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you realize what a big deal this is? What an honour it is to be chosen to go into space?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, I get it. I just wish you included me in the decision. We’re supposed to be partners. We’re supposed to be a team.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sorry. You’re right. Okay, let’s try this again. Bernadette, an opportunity has come up that impacts both of us, and I’d like to discuss it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ve been offered a chance to go up to the International Space Station for three weeks. What are your thoughts on that?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, first of all, thank you for including me in the decision-making process.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, we’re a team. So, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well why not?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard, my father was a police officer. We never knew from one night to the next if he was going to come home alive. It was horrible. And I don’t want to live that way with you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, my father abandoned me and my mother when I was 11. We never saw him again.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, boo-hoo, you’re not going to space!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Pretty cool about Howard, huh?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t talk to me as if nothing’s happened between us. And yes, it sure is, buddy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: For God’s sake, will you stop with the Schrodinger stuff.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Would you prefer a simpler application of Heisenberg’s uncertainty principle, in which I could either know where you are or whether I like you, but not both?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You never stop talking, do you?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t understand. What differences does it make if Leonard goes to Wil Wheaton’s party?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wil Wheaton is Sheldon’s mortal enemy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Mortal enemy?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I know you’re a bit of a left-handed monkey wrench, but, you really have a mortal enemy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: In fact, I have 61 of them. Would you like to see the list?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, say no, say no, say no, say no.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You just got off the list. Would you like back on it? This’ll just take a moment. It’s on a five and a quarter inch floppy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: A floppy disk?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I started the list when I was nine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How did Wil Wheaton get on the list?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh! Oh, God!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: As a child, I loved Wesley Crusher, Wil Wheaton’s character on Star Trek. So, I drove for hours by bus to a Star Trek convention at which Wil Wheaton was scheduled to appear, so that I could get my Wesley Crusher action figure signed. But he never showed, because apparently, it was cooler for him to be the lower-left corner on Hollywood Squares. Oh, damn! The floppy failed. Well, whoever was in charge of quality control at the Verbatim Corporation in 1989, congratulations, you just made the list.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Change your mind about sex? I’m still mad, but I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, I’ve just been thinking. It doesn’t matter if I’m afraid for your safety. I don’t want to be the person who stands between you and your dreams.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really. If going into space means that much to you, I will never say another word about it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I love you, too. So, sex now?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay. I just forgot to brush my teeth. I’ll be right back.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Over my dead body my son goes into outer space!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m ready.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, let me see if I got this right. You actually asked Bernadette to leave your house in the middle of the night?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What choice did I have? She went behind my back and turned my own mother against me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow. You’re not only our first astronaut. You’re also the first one of us to kick a girl out of bed. You’re like a rock star.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Little bit.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I hate to say it, but she did kind of betray you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting. You see betrayal in others, but not yourself.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Going to Wheaton’s party is not betraying you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, of course you would have to believe that. Evil always thinks it’s doing right. Excuse me, Stormtrooper. These are the droids you’re looking for.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m going to a party. I’m not turning R2-D2 and C-3PO over to the empire!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, what’s gonna happen next? Are you and Bernadette going to break up?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. If we’re going to get back together, she’s going to have to apologize and accept that I’m a grown man who can make his own decisions.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Then she’s going to have to convince your mother to let you go into space.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Obviously.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I had no choice. I had to tell his mother. He can’t go to space. He’s like a baby bird. Do you know he once got an asthma attack from reading an old library book?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re kidding.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I was there that day. Sheldon threw his back out handing him that book.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know what I’m going to do. I don’t want to break up over this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, why don’t you just tell him you made a mistake?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do you guys think it was a mistake? Am I the bad guy in this?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s not for us to judge. We’re just here to provide comfort and support while you come to grips with what a despicable thing you’ve done.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, God, you’re right. I took our love and threw it under his bus-sized mother. I need to apologize.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, that, that’s good. I’m glad you came to that. But before you do, let me just ask you a big picture question.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you a hundred percent positive you love and want to marry Howard Wolowitz?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I do, with all my heart.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Got it. Just had to check.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: He’s great.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, Sheldon, we’re going to Wil’s. This is your last chance.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, Leonard, this is your last chance. One day, a historian is going to come to you and say, is it true you were friends with Dr. Sheldon Cooper? And you’re going to have to choke back a hot sob of regret and humiliation as you mumble, I was, but I chose to go to a party thrown by the one kid from Stand By Me that no one remembers.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You want to drive?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good. You picked me, you picked me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I just got a text from Stuart. Brent Spiner is at the party.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Brent Spiner?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t care.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? Brent Spiner, Mr. Data himself. You love him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I did, but I think I’ve kind of outgrown Star Trek. You know, stock characters, ludicrous plots, beam me up. What a load of hooey.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m going. Live long and prosper, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, even that. You look like a dork.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Howard, Bernadette’s here!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Tell her I’m not home!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: What kind of a schmuck play is that? She can hear you shouting!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Can we talk?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You can. I have nothing to say.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: All right. I just wanted to tell you I’m sorry I said something to your mother.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I was gonna tell her eventually, but you went behind my back.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I know. I’m sorry. I got scared.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If you’re gonna love me, you’re gonna have to love the whole package, the tenderhearted poet and the crazy daredevil.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, don’t say it if you’re not gonna mean it, ’cause I’m not just gonna stop with the space station. Yeah, I want to go to the Moon, I want to go to Mars. I want to take a one-man sub to the lowest depths of the ocean.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really? You got seasick on Pirates of the Caribbean.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, those big kids were rocking it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I just did what I did because I love you so much, and the thought of losing you is more than I can handle.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re my soul mate. This is where you kiss me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Right, right.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Make up all you want! Your tuchus is not leaving this planet!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, you know that beautiful actress who plays the Borg Queen in First Contact?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I just met her gynaecologist!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fighting for our friendship. As peculiar and annoying as you can be, you’re still my little buddy. I’m not going to let that end here tonight. Now put down that drink, let’s meet Brent Spiner and go home.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, I’m so glad you made it. I found something I think you might like.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What I’d like is for him to have a more depressing home. This is quite lovely.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: This is for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: An original mint-in-package Wesley Crusher action figure.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: I remembered your story about the time you went to a convention when you were a kid to get one signed, and I didn’t show up.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Look at what I wrote.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To Sheldon, sorry this took so long. Your friend, Wil Wheaton.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: It’s my last one. I want you to have it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look, everyone. Wil Wheaton is my friend!

utterance.speaker: Brent Spiner
utterance.content: Oh, wow. I haven’t seen one of these in years. Remember how we used to make these things look like they were masturbating?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Brent Spiner, what have you done? That was an original mint-in-package Wesley Crusher action figure signed by my close personal friend, Wil Wheaton.

utterance.speaker: Brent
utterance.content: Sorry, Slim. I’ve got some Mr. Data dolls in the trunk of my car. You want me to sign one for you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’ve already signed something, Brent Spiner. Your name on my list. From this moment on, you are my mortal enemy.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Don’t worry. It doesn’t take up a whole lot of your time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Come on, buddy. Let’s not waste another second on this loser. Love your house.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can we get autographed dolls?

utterance.speaker: Brent
utterance.content: Sure. Twenty bucks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ten.

utterance.speaker: Brent
utterance.content: Eighteen.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Twelve.

utterance.speaker: Brent
utterance.content: Sixteen.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Two for thirty. And you come to my birthday party.

utterance.speaker: Brent
utterance.content: Done.
